materials.raw_text: La: 80 g, Nd: 30 g, Sb: 40 g, Sn: 40 g

sourcing.instructions: La (Lanthanum) - Purchase from a chemical supplier or online marketplace; Nd (Neodymium) - Buy from a rare earth metal supplier; Sb (Antimony) - Obtain from a chemical supply store; Sn (Tin) - Available at hardware stores or metal suppliers.
steps: La (Lanthanum) - Purchase from a chemical supplier or online marketplace; Nd (Neodymium) - Buy from a rare earth metal supplier; Sb (Antimony) - Obtain from a chemical supply store; Sn (Tin) - Available at hardware stores or metal suppliers.

1. Weigh out 80 g of La, 30 g of Nd, 40 g of Sb, and 40 g of Sn using a precision balance. 2. Mix the powders in a clean, dry container using a spatula until uniform. 3. Transfer the mixture to a ball mill and mill for 2 hours to ensure homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 80 g of La, 30 g of Nd, 40 g of Sb, and 40 g of Sn using a precision balance. 2. Mix the powders in a clean, dry container using a spatula until uniform. 3. Transfer the mixture to a ball mill and mill for 2 hours to ensure homogeneity.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 950°C. 2. Place the milled mixture in a crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to allow the formation of the alloy.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 950°C. 2. Place the milled mixture in a crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to allow the formation of the alloy.

steps: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approx. 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approx. 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid oxidation.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Grind the edges to achieve desired dimensions (3 x 2 x 7 inches) using a diamond grinder. 3. Polish the surface with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Grind the edges to achieve desired dimensions (3 x 2 x 7 inches) using a diamond grinder. 3. Polish the surface with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to prevent oxidation.
